titleStmt.title: The true confession of Mr. George Norton, concerning the murther of Mr. Harris the dancing-master, on the 11th of June last. Taken out of his own papers, delivered by him to Mrs. Mary Edwards, before he took the fatal draught of poyson, on the 8th of August, of which he died the next following day, which was appointed for his execution at Tyburn.
titleStmt.author: Norton, George, d. 1699.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by D. Edwards in Fetter-Lane,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
